oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Archibald Roane to Tennessee Representative William Dickson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this letter, Roane alerts Tennessee Representative William Dickson that Congress will be meeting to discuss the Cession of Louisiana. In Roane's opinion, this matter is of great importance to the state of Tennessee and he recommends that Dickson go to the meeting.

In 1803, the United States acquired approximately 827,000 square miles of land west of the Mississippi River for $15 million. This land deal with France, known as the Louisiana Purchase, was a major feature of Thomas Jefferson's presidency. The territory contained present-day Arkansas, Missouri, Iowa, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Nebraska and parts of present-day Minnesota, North Dakota, South Dakota, New Mexico, Texas, Montana, Wyoming, and Colorado, and Louisiana.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roane, Archibald
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Roane, Archibald, 1759-1819; Louisiana
